Cable Access For Canadian Isps

08 Jul 1999

The Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) has released a decision that Canadian cable companies must allow ISPs access to their cable infrastructure. Hopefully this will mean faster and cheaper Internet access for Canadians!

ISPs in the U.S. are currently also petitioning the government to impose similar rules against American cable operators.
